title: What is the meaning of forensic chemistry? - Quora

response.answer_text: Forensic science, also known as criminalistics, is the application of science to criminal and civil laws, mainly—on the criminal side—during criminal investigation, ...from Wikepedia. So in forensic Chemistry we apply the chemistry of our work, i.e., data, instrumentation and chemical process to a material or substance and make an identification. From the identification we apply this result(s) to the court of law either by testimony or report. The end result is to explain chemistry to individuals in court.

Forensic chemistry is the application of chemistry and its subfield, forensic toxicology, in a legal setting. A forensic chemist can assist in the identification of unknown materials found at a crime scene. Specialists in this field have a wide array of methods and instruments to help identify unknown substances.
